data.title: Initial check-in of .Core solution
data.body:
Moved non-platform specific classes to a central PCL project, for reuse by frameworks using basic MG types.

Next step, generate Bait and switch separate PCL for platform specific types/classes

data.title: Fix for TextureImporter when importing dds files with simple texture
data.body:
Second try after fixing the problem with line endings (see #4334).
After #4136, texture importer couldn't handle a simple texture inside a dds file.
This pull fixes that and adds two tests.
One test imports a simple texture, and the second imports a texture with mipmaps

data.title: [Direct3D] Fix setting fullscreen state while device not being ready
data.body:
Fixes #4148

I'm not 100% confident about this one. What should be checked:
- if it uses the correct method to compare exception's HRESULT
- if it is safe to retry setting the fullscreen state after `_swapChain.Present(syncInterval, PresentFlags.None);`

This bug is really hard to reproduce, so I'm going to roll this PR out to our game today and will check if the problem is still referenced in our crash reports DB over the week. I've never been able to observe it locally, but we're typically getting about 1 of these crashes per day, so I'll be able to monitor its occurrence.

data.title: MaterialProcessor Unit Test
data.body:
It would be really good to get a unit test for `MaterialProcessor` place sort of like we have for the `TextureProcessor`:

https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/blob/develop/Test/ContentPipeline/TextureProcessorTests.cs

This could have caught a bug like https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/pull/4324 sooner.

data.title: Getting the Content Pipeline through NuGet
data.body:
This is still a major WIP. Only tested on Windows.

When installing this package, NuGet automatically adds this to the bottom of the file:

```
<Import Project="..\packages\MonoGame.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Build.0.0.0.0\build\MonoGame.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Build.targets" Condition="Exists('..\packages\MonoGame.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Build.0.0.0.0\build\MonoGame.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Build.targets')" />
<Target Name="EnsureNuGetPackageBuildImports" BeforeTargets="PrepareForBuild">
    <PropertyGroup>
        <ErrorText>This project references NuGet package(s) that are missing on this computer. Use NuGet Package Restore to download them.  For more information, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=322105. The missing file is {0}.</ErrorText>
    </PropertyGroup>
    <Error Condition="!Exists('..\packages\MonoGame.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Build.0.0.0.0\build\MonoGame.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Build.targets')" Text="$([System.String]::Format('$(ErrorText)', '..\packages\MonoGame.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Build.0.0.0.0\build\MonoGame.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Build.targets'))" />
</Target>
```

I am not sure how the NuGets are built via TeamCity

data.title: [mgcb] Suppress warnings for assets allready build.
data.body:
Suppress warnings for assets allready build in the current process, otherwise 3D models with multiple textures will flood the output with 'Skipping modelTexture'.
The warning will be shown for unmodified assets when build without '/Rebuild' command.

data.title: [Pipeline] Support Long filenames
data.body:
Open files with long filenames/paths by double click.
Fix #4186

data.title: Fix UAP/UWP Build
data.body:
This PR fixes the Windows UAP/UWP build which was silently broken for months now.

The main issue is that MSBuild doesn't perform the NuGet restore like running from the IDE.  So we applied the recommended work around.

Also we detected that Protobuild was smashing over the existing dependences and kickstart folders with its own git operation on the build agents.  I've disabled this Protobuild feature until that can be fixed.

More details in https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/pull/4323.

data.title: Fixes #4318
data.body: Fixes #4318

data.title: Support the MSBuild content pipeline .targets file on Mac
data.body: I just want to check, is this supported yet? On Windows, the MonoGameSetup.exe adds all the bits into the Program Files. Including the .targets file. On Mac, the .pkg just has assemblies. Is there any reason for this? or am I going about it wrong?

data.title: Some API for remapping Gamepad
data.body:
XNA never needed it since it only used Microsoft controllers, but it would make sense to setup a way for easy remapping of buttons/axes/dpad for Gamepad class.

@tomspilman @KonajuGames @dellis1972 What do you think?

data.title: [Gtk Pipeline] Save preferences between restarts
data.body:
#4266 got merge conflicts, and I broke it....

Stuff that gets saved:
- windows size
- window maximized
- horizontal and vertical separator positions
- filter output toggle
- debug mode toggle

Notes:
- I didn't save window position since the operating system itself handles that better, ie. multimonitor
- I used XmlSerialization
- Gtk already contained "Settings" so I named our settings "PipelineSettings"

milestone.description: More unit tests, running unit tests on Mac and Linux, SDL2 replacing OpenTK.

data.title: Pipeline - Deleting last item in folder deletes folder
data.body:
MonoGame 3.4
Visual Studio 2010
Windows 7

Go to pipeline
Add new folder
Add item to folder (any kind-- model, texture, whatever)
Later, delete the only item in that folder

Expectation:  Item deleted, with empty folder remaining

Actual:  Item is deleted, folder is deleted too.

(So now I have to recreate the folder to add another item to the folder)

data.title: Pipeline - UX - Add New Folder - Enter key
data.body:
Monogame 3.4
VS2010
MonoGame PipeLine

Click Edit -> Add -> New Folder
Type folder name
press ENTER

Expectation:  Same as clicking "OK" button

Actual result:  Enter key ignored

data.title: [NuGet] Automatically adding the MonoGame project file elements
data.body:
Hi guys.

I was just wondering if a PR for adding the `<MonoGamePlatform>` and `<Import>` elements to the project files automatically is something that I could do? Each time I install MonoGame into a new project, I have to manually edit the files and add it. Not too hard, but very annoying. We can do this automatically without any strange scripts and things. 

Basically, according to the [docs](http://docs.nuget.org/create/Creating-and-Publishing-a-Package#import-msbuild-targets-and-props-files-into-project), we can add a `.props` file that adds the `<MonoGamePlatform>` element based on the NuGet installed. As each NuGet has a single platform, there will be no confusion. Then, we just add the `.targets` file to the NuGet and it will automatically be referenced.

I have done this with several projects, and is very useful. It works in Visual Studio, Xamarin Studio/MonoDevelop. If anything fails, such as some random IDE, it can still be added manually.

Windows GL gives Song not a wave file error.

data.title: Mac OS Permissions for ffmpeg and ffprobe
data.body:
By default, the installed Pipeline.app has permissions set as follows:

```
-rw-r--r-x   1 root  wheel  22810832 Nov  2 08:38 ffmpeg
-rw-r--r-x   1 root  wheel  22762608 Nov  2 08:38 ffprobe
```

In order for sound effects to process properly, permissions need to be set by default with installer to:

```
-rwxr--r-x   1 root  wheel  22810832 Nov  2 08:38 ffmpeg
-rwxr--r-x   1 root  wheel  22762608 Nov  2 08:38 ffprobe
```

data.title: Remove Storage Classes
data.body:
I am proposing the full removal of the existing storage classes:
- [StorageContainer.cs](https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/blob/develop/MonoGame.Framework/Storage/StorageContainer.cs)
- [StorageDevice.cs](https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/blob/develop/MonoGame.Framework/Storage/StorageDevice.cs)
- [StorageDeviceHelper.cs](https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/blob/develop/MonoGame.Framework/Storage/StorageDeviceHelper.cs)

Back in https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/issues/2389 I was suggesting redesign, but really after seeing more console SDKs and how each one uses a different method for storage (as well as different TRC requirements)...  it seems better to just drop support for this old API entirely.

Then at a later date if we can work out something that works in all cases we can talk about adding a new API.

So is anyone using this functionality?  Would it be missed at all?

data.title: Default SetConstantBuffers
data.body: Fixed `SetConstantBuffers` to have a default path without any extra arguments.  This is generally how the function is used on all platforms.  This makes things easier when implementing new platforms.
